website_summaries.verdict: Toothpaste inhibits formation of plaque while battling bad breath. Well-liked flavor simplifies brushing of the dog's teeth.
pros: Even dogs with sensitive stomachs have no problems swallowing toothpaste, owners say
They also report dogs feel like it's a treat and want to use it
Does a great job with keeping teeth clean
cons: Cost per ounce is a little high versus some other options in the market
Some owners dislike the toothpaste's odor

customer_reviews.title: Contains Sorbitol
customer_reviews.text: Shame on me! Don’t use this for you pets. First ingredient is Sorbitol! My dog became very ill the first time I used it to brush her teeth! She was sick for two days vomiting and not eating. I switched from Vets Best thought she would enjoy the flavor, I should have read the ingredients learned my lesson. Vets Best is made and distributed here in the USA. No Sorbitol and natural ingredients, never any problems. Ordered Vets Best again and will continue to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Beware ! Mold inside !!
customer_reviews.text: Beware !!! Totally shocked at what came out of this , seems like some type of mold !! My dog has been throwing up for a week (we thought it was allergies) now I realized it is probably this!! Stay away!!
customer_reviews.author: shay d

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! Spoiled product
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this product for our dog a few years now. We bought two tubes on 9/12/18 from Amazon. After opening one of the new tubes, our dog resisted having her teeth brushed which she never had before. When squeezing out a glob recently a dark oozy substance squeezed out! It was either mold or it was spoiled! The return policy has expired to return to Amazon. I am writing the maker to see what they will do. Had my dog gotten sick all hell would have broke loose!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Sagrillo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After a month of brushing my dogs teeth almost everyday this is the results. I am very pleased with this product. Im glad i didnt spend $400 on a dental and tried this product first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POISONING DANGER!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE! LEACHES LEAD/TIN FROM NOZZLE. TRY IT YOURSELF, EVERY SWIPE OF NOZZLE RESULTS IN METAL WASTE FROM TUBE NOZEL INTO PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Contained a green slimy substance
customer_reviews.text: It contained a green slimy substance. Looked like algae or something. We had to throw it away. Makes us question the quality of this product
customer_reviews.author: Tired of Crappy Movies

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch? Brown toothpaste....
customer_reviews.text: It must have been a spoiled batch although the expiration date isn’t until 2020. I’ve purchased this toothpaste for the past 3 years and it’s always been an ivory-colored paste. This tube squeezed out a brown goo initially and much of the rest was a light brown (see pics). The rest squeezed out the regular color, but I was worried it would make my dog sick to use it... I thought purchasing directly from Amazon was safer than from 3rd party vendors and am disappointed. I requested a return for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ECL

customer_reviews.title: Warning... You may want to order poultry flavor
customer_reviews.text: There has either been a change in formulation or factory error. Use to be a brown paste. This is now a clear gel, that doesn't smell like beef and tastes sweet. There are reported cases that the wrong product is loaded into tubes, and I hope that is not the case. If there has been a drastic formula change, the company needs to repackage. AND my dog also doesn't like it, which makes me suspicious that this may not be the intended product.
customer_reviews.author: hiroxbmw

customer_reviews.title: BROWN TOOTHPASTE
customer_reviews.text: Received this item and was very disappointed to see that this toothpaste was BROWN when I opened the tube. I looked in the reviews and this toothpaste should be a white to off-white color. Unfortunately, it's headed to the trash as I don't feel comfortable giving this to my dog. The expiration date on this item is 03/2020 so I do not see why or how this would happen. I will be getting this toothpaste from my vet from now on. Waste. Of. Time.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Wiens-Evangelista

customer_reviews.title: 😺My schnauzer loves this toothpaste just look at his picture😺
customer_reviews.text: My schnauzer loves this toothpaste. Recommended by my veterinarian. Works with enzymes to clean plaque off his teeth. He looks forward to his tooth being brushed every day. It costs less here on Amazon thatn my veterinarians office.
customer_reviews.author: MissyTop Contributor: Organic Food

customer_reviews.title: Mold
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Mold coming out of a newly opened toothpaste tube!!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Black substance
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the new tube, there was a black substance on the inside of the cap and on the first inch of paste. I should have contacted the manufacturer, but I was aggravated and threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: THIS TOOTHPASTE GAVE MY DOG DIARRHEA !!
customer_reviews.text: The first ingredient in this toothpaste is SORBITAL . It gave my Maltese diarrhea !! ALL OVER his long white coat. Sorbital,besides being an artificial sweetener, is known to cause diarrhea, I discovered after researching it . A dog should NOT be given an artifical sweetener to begin with, Much less one that causes DIARRHEA !!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Stroehlein

customer_reviews.title: Bizarre taste and odd appearance. Different than in the past
customer_reviews.text: Yikes, I've used CET products successfully in the past, but this was a big fail. I ordered the beef but was sent vanilla-mint by mistake. When I contacted Amazon they promptly resent the correct flavor-Beef- but this one is a completely clear gel. I tasted a speck off my finger, and there's zero taste except sort of an artificially sweetened gelatin. My dog flattens himself, backs away and refuses to accept it. (Normally, while he doesn't love tooth brushing, he will at least tolerate it.)
customer_reviews.author: cookie

customer_reviews.title: Good Taste = Pet Accepts Brushing
customer_reviews.text: Taste is VERY IMPORTANT so that pet looks forward to and accepts brushing. I am a veterinarian who only does dentistry and this product is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE! MAKE MY DOG SICK!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE ON YOUR DOG!!!!!!After the first time using this toothpaste, my husky vomited and didn't eat anything on the second day. Also the toothpaste turned brown the second day I opened it. I feel so sorry for my dog. Future customers please do not buy, I should have read the reviews first but trusted too much on the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Serious plaque remover!!!
customer_reviews.text: This flavor actually removes the plaque over a week or two of daily brushing! I was amazed and happy... no expensive vet bill and anesthesia to clean my dog's teeth. The poultry flavor has a different initial chemical listed and works differently. The poultry prevents plaque, but the beef removes existing plaque.
customer_reviews.author: LottieDah

customer_reviews.title: Trust the Reviews about MOLD!
customer_reviews.text: My kittens loved the taste of this toothpaste, and I used it for two months until one day I opened the tube and noticed it looked a little green. I squeezed a little bit out, and still green. I tried squeezing more out and this HUGE clump of mold came out of the tube. Disgusting!! For reference, I have LOT# 181141, EXP 10-2021.
customer_reviews.author: tfisch17

customer_reviews.title: Company needs to clarify WHY their product arrives brown and unsealed for so many
customer_reviews.text: I just received this toothpaste and, like many others on here, the toothpaste I received is discolored, brown and it arrived unsealed. The fact that neither the company nor Amazon have publicly addressed why their product arrives brown and unsealed when it is clearly a recurring issue is extremely worrisome. This product is consistently one of the top rated toothpastes for dogs when you do a google search, however, multiple people are receiving a product that could be potentially dangerous. What is going on here?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MOLDY
customer_reviews.text: I received the product, and there was mold growing on the inside!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: No Longer a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We have used this product for our dogs for years and it has been great. However, we just opened our third defective package where some type of brown substance is in the toothpaste. This is not normal and never occurred until this year. There are other reviews indicating similar results. Unfortunately, we will not switch to another brand as it seems this manufacturer has lost control of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Paste was dark brown/brown in two different shipments and made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: I've used the product before and it worked wonders, but twice has it come unsealed and brown when it's supposed to be white. I thought I might be overthinking things about the color, so I used it anyway for my dog (aside from the color, I didn't notice anything unusual). It was a mistake clearly because my dog threw up a bit later and was sick for the rest of that night. I don't know if it's an Amazon handling issue or a change in the production, but I can't stress enough to not order this product at all or at least not online for the safety of your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Tri Le

customer_reviews.title: No Safety Seal
customer_reviews.text: The tube does not have a safety seal. The tube had black mold. I did not consider it to be safe for my dogs and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to return and informed I’m not allowed to! I cannot use this product because it’s brown! This item is BAD and I would like my money back!!!! Received two bottles, both brown! I WILL not put this crap in my dogs mouth! You guys should be sued!
customer_reviews.author: Jenise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed to find out the toothpaste is *not* supposed to be brown
customer_reviews.text: My dog pooped blood after I brushed his teeth with this toothpaste. I figured I'd check to see if anyone else experienced something similar. To my surprise, I found that the toothpaste was not supposed to be brown, which mine happened to be. Into the trash it went. Will use baking soda/water moving forward. I do not trust any dog toothpaste, especially this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived in a box that looked like it had been open before. Was not sealed and toothpaste was brown. I’ve bought this a few times before and it has always been a white color. I just came across other reviews saying that it made their dog sick. Looks disgusting and I refuse to give it to my dog. How convenient that there is a no return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Liz N

customer_reviews.title: It works and my dogs enjoy the taste!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. It was packaged in a cardboard box. My dogs love this product. The beef flavored is my dogs favorite. The dog paste is clear. I cannot smell the beef flavor, but the dogs like it and their teeth are nice and clean. This is important to me, because one of my dogs has a heart murmur and I am trying to keep her teeth disease free as that is the start of most problems for dogs and humans. I would recommend this product to all dog owners.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brown Vanilla Mint Toothpaste?
customer_reviews.text: When we opened the new tube of Virbac C.E.T. Plaque Tartar Control Enzymatic Dog Vanilla Mint Toothpaste, the toothpaste was a watery texture instead of a creamy smooth paste and it was dark brown instead of having a white/off white color. After squeezing out some of the product, the texture became more creamy but the color remained brown. (see photo) The substance in the tube also had a metallic/chemical odor that overpowered the vanilla mint scent.
customer_reviews.author: aloibay

customer_reviews.title: Cant get an order right?????
customer_reviews.text: I order 2 mint flavor dog toothpaste. I got poultry flavor. Bar code says vanilla mint but box and tube is poultry. Will start getting this from somewhere else ( like chewy.com) since you cant get something as simple as this right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: This item came with no safety foil seal or a sealed box. Plus it’s a gooey clear gel. I put some on my finger to see if my dogs were interested so I would return and RE-order, but no. They walked the other way. It did not smell like beef flavor AT ALL. Added: asked my vet dental tech for a toothpaste suggestion, she said if they don’t like toothpaste try coconut oil. Anything that they will let me brush. Sometimes I use some dental ozone oil too between professional non-anesthetic cleanings.
customer_reviews.author: Leela R

customer_reviews.title: Good When Not Rotten
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well when it isn't rotten. Unfortunately we fell in love with this toothpaste the first time we bought it....but every time since then the toothpaste has come to us in a brown color that it is not supposed to be. Multiple other customers have had the same issue with this product and we felt as they did...that it was not safe to give to our dog in that state. We have had to reorder the toothpaste every time. It has come in better condition when reordering but then the next time we buy it it's brown again. If the manufacturer reads this, please remedy this issue or put a statement out about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Boyum

customer_reviews.title: Brown/Moldy Product.
customer_reviews.text: Never seen this separation in then toothpaste before and have used this in the past multiple times. Brown and clear liquid came out. Will try to get refunded for this. Expiration date was for 2023
customer_reviews.author: R^2

customer_reviews.title: It's a no from my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this brand from veterinarian before and dog has loved it. This is different...a glycerin-y gel with no discernible beef smell, and clear. May be fine for manual brushing but dogs show no interest in chew-brusher with this product in it. Maybe just spend a couple bucks more and buy directly from vet.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about 8 months ago but didn't use it since I had sample packets from my vet of toothpaste for my dog. I just opened this product and found that the contents were not the toothpaste. There was a clear gel inside the tube and it did not smell like Beef toothpaste at all. I took it to the vet and they were surprised and wondered also what was actually in the toothpaste tube. It went into the garbage after I picked up a new tube of toothpaste for my dog from my vet. Can toothpaste go bad after only 8 months?
customer_reviews.author: sandeej

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste does not get my dog's teeth clean. The salmon flavor worked very well, and I bought it for years. This last time, it was not available. Although I ordered vanilla mint, I got poultry. It was tool late to return it. I can't recommend this toothpaste.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherGalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Smells like cupcakes🐾🐶
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste is amazing - puppies breath will smell so clean & thier teeth will be super clean!!!! My fur ball really enjoys having his teeth cleaned with this toothpaste - the very first time I brushed his teeth with it - later that evening my husband was playing with him and thought he had gotten into the cupcakes u made earlier in the day!!! Nope it was the toothpaste - love the smell and only use this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Really effective toothpaste GEL
customer_reviews.text: I had used only the poultry flavored paste for my little dog in the past. I was a little concerned with the reviews about the beef flavored GEL. I like it better because it's easier to work with. Sometimes the paste would get on his fur around his mouth. This is easier and he does not object at all. BUT he is a good little boy!!
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: The paste should be white not brown
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for years, based on recommendation from my vet. I have been buying it from Amazon, with no issues. I bought two tubes of this last month, beginning of September, and just opened both. The paste is brown. It should be white. I don't know what that is. I threw both tubes out.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my kitty! She's 4 years old and I had never brushed her teeth before, but her breath had always been repulsive. Most cats breath stinks, but hers was just ghastly. I decided to get some toothpaste and try to get her teeth brushed. She's a really laid back cat so it was super easy for me. I just plop her on my chest while I lay on the couch and she let's me scrub. Her breath has vastly improved. Started with seafood flavor and then out of curiosity got the vanilla mint. My weirdo cat likes the mint better lol now her breath reminds me of cupcakes.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Brown doesn’t mean bad!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great toothpaste! Really has helped my dogs tarter on her cainine teeth. I got the Vanilla/Mint flavor. To the people complaining that their toothpaste comes out brown instead of white. That happened to me too, but it’s normal. It’s just everything that has settled, if you squeeze a little out it soon turns white. It hasn’t gone bad, just separated a little. I mean look at your vanilla extract in your cupboard...it’s brown. Obviously I could be wrong in some instances, but just try to squeeze out a small portion and see if it turns white. That’s all it takes. My dog loves the taste and it doesn’t smell awful like a lot of them!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nice smell, Thick formula
customer_reviews.text: After the last teeth cleaning with our pup, the vet advised brushing with an enzymatic toothpaste. He gave us a sample of this brand but in the poultry flavor and I couldn't stand the smell, although the dog didn't mind the taste. So I ordered a full sized tube in the vanilla mint. It has a nice, pleasant, fresh smell. This brand is nice and thick so it stays on the brush better than other brands I have tried. My pup doesn't mind the flavor. I have only been using it for a short time so I don't know how well it will work for the prevention of tartar build up, long term.
customer_reviews.author: Denver's Mom

customer_reviews.title: wrong toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of the vanilla-mint and received 4 poultry flavored. The item was headlined as vanilla mint but if you look really good at the picture it says poultry on the bottom. VERY MISLEADING!!! I would not have ordered 4 and paid that price if I had known it was poultry. Really disappointed in Amazon lately....this is the 3rd mistake I have had to go through with them in the past few months.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Toothpaste came looking expired! Be aware of the color!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been using this toothpaste for about 2 years. I always buy the vanilla mint flavor and the toothpaste is always white! I recently bought a new tube and this time the toothpaste has a brown color! It seems like it’s expired or something. It looks disgusting!!! Then I thought it was just that tube so I went and bought another one. It came brown again! It definitely does not look right! Be aware of the color! I will contact their customer service soon and ask for an explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: Hard enough to brush dog's teeth, this paste didn't help
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised on receiving this that it was a clear gel, and not a paste like the poultry flavor toothpaste. My dog enjoys having her teeth brushed with the poultry flavor, but resisted with this beef-flavored gel. I exchanged it for another poultry one (which had been out of stock when I bought the beef).
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopping Maven

customer_reviews.title: Discolored/bad batch
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to see this Virbac toothpaste on Amazon as I normally purchase it from my vet at twice the price. I’ve been using it for years. However, I was very disappointed with the 2 toothpaste tubes that I received from Amazon. I just finished with the toothpaste from the vet (which has always been a nice lighter cream color) and went to open one of the ones I purchased here. The new toothpaste was darkly discolored and had a two tone look, so I didn’t want to give it to my dog. Sadly, I bought two tubes and both had the same issue since they were the same batch date.
customer_reviews.author: Artistic fan

customer_reviews.title: Vanilla scent much better than meat-flavored toothpaste!
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes the flavor (she sits and begs for more) and doesn’t seem to mind my brushing her teeth anymore. I’ve tried meat-flavored toothpaste (dog loves this!) and other meat flavors to trick her into opening her jaw but it seems counterproductive to brush meat flavors on the teeth and have breath smell like meat. 🤪 Like people breath, dog breath can be shocking esp. if your dog is affectionate and loves to kiss. It’s worth it to get dogs used to brushing to delay THE DRILL, post op bleeding and pain, and expense at the Vet’s office.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: My dog has had her teeth brushed nightly with this toothpaste (beef flavor) since I brought her home 2.5 yrs ago. They are pearly white. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it contains sorbitol, which I’m not sure is a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: this does not help with my dogs bad breath....also cant tell if it is removing any plaqure or tartar
customer_reviews.text: so my toothpaste came white unlike some of the other reviews, but this toothpaste is doing nothing to combat my dogs bad breath. His breath smells good for about an 1-2 after brushing, but then is gone. I also can't tell if this toothpaste is doing anything for his tartar build up or plaque...his two incisors that have brown/black at the gum still have the same coloring two months later. I guess I just have to assume that if its not removing it..at least it is preventing any more...
customer_reviews.author: C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves flavor
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this stuff! I bought it on recommendation from allaboutcats.com (they have great and detailed product reviews). We used to use petrodex malt flavored toothpaste but I heard this enzymatic one was the best. My cat loves the taste and I can even use his toothbrush + this toothpaste as a treat. Our second cat doesn’t like it, but he’s generally picky. Hard to say how effective this is but his breath is fine and no dental issues as he’s very young!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product exploded when I broke the seal. It had a chemical smell and was runny. My previous tube of the same toothpaste had a nice vanilla scent and a normal consistency. Since I am not able to return it I just wasted money on a bad product. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Beware -  quality/color change
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a different flavor for my pup (CET has BEEF) just for change of taste. Firstly, CET is more expensive than competition's. Secondly, the metal on the cap appears to be changing color. It almost looks like the silver has tarnished and it's turning black?! It's disconcerting even though it doesn't change the flavor of the toothpaste. But the cap/metal part does come in contact with the toothpaste. For these reasons I would not be purchasing CET toothpaste anymore. :(
customer_reviews.author: EYCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Brown Paste
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this toothpaste for approximately a year with my puppy (that one worked great!), but I went to buy it again from Amazon but as others have mentioned the tubes are not sealed and the toothpaste contains a disgusting brown paste. I asked for a replacement and now I have two tubes of unsealed brown toothpaste. Seems like amazon is selling counterfeit/defective products? Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ford-Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Tooth paste was mixed with brown liquid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before for my cats and was pure white the entire tube, but the second time we got it it was brown and white. The brown parts were more liquidy and less thick than the white toothpaste portion. The box's expiration stated it was good for two more years, so this is concerning.
customer_reviews.author: Broke College Student

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!!
customer_reviews.text: It seems this product is contaminated or has ingredients that causes my dog to have some adverse reactions. Her breathing became fast and heavy after 5 minutes of use, and it was obvious she was distressed. I thought it was odd and tested using another brand of toothpaste and sure enough, it pointed back to this brand. In reading other reviews, some of the flavored ones contained mold/fungus in them!!! Needless to say, i threw this essential poison into the garbage and DO NOT recommend it to anyone who value the health of their dog.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I was cautious and paid attention to the color of the paste. It's exactly as some have warned against, it was mixed with a stream of brown, I'm not sure if that's the product going bad or what- there's no way I'm taking the risk.
customer_reviews.author: suzpop

customer_reviews.title: My cats like the flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I feel my cats eat the toothpaste as the compensating treat for having a teeth brush. They love the flavor. The product is probably working well. I have been using this product for my older kitten since he was only 7 months old. He just turned 1 year old, and the vet said that his teeth were very healthy during his birthday annual checkup. I decided to give the product a four-star instead of a five-star for only one reservation. My cats' months smell fishy sometimes for unknown reasons (the vet doesn't know why either). I was hoping the toothpaste would help get rid of it, but it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Boyang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: My corgi approves, mostly!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my dog is in her senior years and the dental treats my vet recommended weren't doing anything for her plaque and buildup. I chose this brand because it's what they sell at my vet's office, so I thought it should be a safe/healthy option for her. I ordered the Vanilla Mint flavor, and although she wasn't a fan of the actual brushing, she likes the flavor and she cooperates (mostly). I didn't see any huge difference immediately in the discoloration on her teeth but I'm going to keep using it and see what happens. Her breath is already better, and I hope that at the very least I can prevent any more buildup from accumulating.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry C.

customer_reviews.title: Came less than half full. Filled with air
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this product because of all the positive reviews. When I got the toothpaste, I opened it and was surprised to find out that the tube was half filled with air! I squeeze all the way from the bottom to get to the tooth paste. By the time the first amount of toothpaste was accessible, more than half the tube had already been compressed! Bad quality control if this was allowed to happen.
customer_reviews.author: V. T

customer_reviews.title: FAKE COUNTERFEIT TOOTHPASTE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 tubes from seller ME AND TREE which Amazon shipped for them and they were counterfeit. The ink off the tube was rubbing off on my hand. The boxes themselves were faded looking copies. The toothpaste itself was nasty and had a nasty scent to it. The color was off and brownThis was not the product I ordered and Amazon sent me fake toothpaste. I am past the 30 day return policy. This is NOT right to sell counterfeit fake toothpaste and not allow a buyer to return. NOT COOL!
customer_reviews.author: Cartman

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to have issues with this product as well given all the 5 stars reviews but our dog started vomiting after starting using this product and that is the only thing that has changed with her routine.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE STOP SELLING THIS! Product is SPOILED.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, was skeptical because of the reviews but they are correct!! Got the vanilla mint flavor, expires in 2023 and as soon as i opened, there is brown stuff coming out when i squeeze the tube! Why is this still being sold?? There was not even a protective seal on it.... scary that this is still being sold on here even after all the bad comments.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Bad lot #200142 exp 01 23
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a couple years and have not had any problems until now. Just like Jason, I received a tube of brown and cream colored toothpaste. I assumed the product was just not mixed properly and used it two times. It may have been a coincidence, but my dog had loose stool the following days. I contacted Virbac and they said to return/replace the product with Amazon. Unfortunately, my return time has expired. Note: Virbac did record the Lot # for quality information.
customer_reviews.author: Joan I

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My dog actually loves this tooth paste... The chicken and beef flavor smells awful. It was awful brushing his teeth without gaging. The vanilla is a delightful sent without that taste dogs hate. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Teeth
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this toothpaste on my dogs for years and I believe it's helpful for their oral hygiene. When I take them for their yearly checkups, the Vet comments how nice their teeth are. One of my dogs is 14 years old now and her teeth are white and healthy. I usually brush their teeth 3 times a week for reference and I use a toothbrush for a child. Takes about 2 minutes per dog.
customer_reviews.author: L Major

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't agree with my Maltipoo
customer_reviews.text: This product gave my 8 pound Malti poo the diarrhea. I did a process of elimination as to give the correct review for this product. I used very little toothpaste on a baby's toothbrush. about the size of a small pea, if that
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this through Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying this particular brand and flavor toothpaste for years for my dog, and the one we received through amazon smelled very bad, and emits some kind of gas that makes the toothpaste explode out each time you open it. We tried it twice, and then determined that either it went bad in transit, or was a fake product. There doesn't seem to be a return or refund option on this, so don't make the mistake I did and waste ten bucks on this.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Initially I noticed that the packaging looks like it’s from the 90’s. It is not the same packaging as the picture/current tubes and is faded and worn looking. The toothpaste is more brown rather than “off white” and all this leads me to feel unsafe about the product. I will not be using this product on my dog, I am not going to risk him becoming ill. The shocking part is that this item is not eligible for a return. WHAT?! This was an utter waste of money. I will not be purchasing this from Amazon again and am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: THIS REALLY WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: My ferrets had a heavy buildup of plaque, I tried to use a dental scraper on them and it didn’t work. (Don’t recommend it, it’s so sharp that you might stab them on the gum) I ended up giving this a try, give them a brush every day for TWO months with Colgate toddler soft toothbrush. It really works!! They hated it first, but I did it so often, eventually they got used to it. What I did was I wet the brush first and rub the toothpaste on the brush, brush one side of their mouths for 10-15 times, not too much because they’ll bleed. Don’t give up if you don’t see the result immediately!
customer_reviews.author: RandB

customer_reviews.title: Not the right product?
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was completely different from usual. The box said "poultry flavor" but the packaging was slightly different, a pink-ish box around the flavor instead of gray. The toothpaste was a dark brown color and did not smell like previous CET poultry flavored toothpaste I have bought. My cat did not like the flavor. Perhaps it was beef flavor that was incorrectly packaged in both the tube and box?
customer_reviews.author: K =^..^=

customer_reviews.title: Actually helps with plaque. A+ paste!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this product were spilt so I wasn’t sure I would love it, but decided to take a chance. So happy I did! I have 2 senior dogs who have developed rancid breath due to my laziness in regular brushing. I saw a substantial difference in visible plaque on teeth with just one use. Breath improved also, although I need to be consistent with brushing daily or every other day to really keep their kisses tolerable. A+ for effectiveness & A+ for flavor. My picky dogs happily lick their lips after I’m done brushing them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ali_m

customer_reviews.title: Need refund for this
customer_reviews.text: I received this last June 2,2020. I was supposed to use it today for my dog after taking a bath but when i opened it, i saw some brown color mixed with the toothpaste. I didn’t bother to used it to my dog. I was so disappointed coz i ordered this one before and it was good that’s why I reordered again.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo G.

customer_reviews.title: Taste great my dogs like it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs do love the taste and I bought the vanilla mint. The only issue is the cap. It would be better if it were a flip top. The toothpaste is much heavier than regular human tooth paste and it gobs up on the cap due to its “stickiness” and it’s almost impossible to get the cap screwed back on completely.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rees

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't mind the taste
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste comes in a poultry flavor but it grosses me out thinking of brushing my little guy's teeth with poultry flavored toothpaste! Vanilla mint has always been my go to for him and he doesn't mind it at all. He is a Maltese and has a tiny mouth so I actually use an electric toothbrush attachment brush with the little round end, not the electric part, just the attachment and I brush his teeth like you would with a regular toothbrush. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernGal820

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love It and it seems to work
customer_reviews.text: We have two small dogs who have had dental problems. Their mouths are small and getting a toothbrush in there is awkward. At the recommendation of my vet I tried this. I put a little directly on my finger and rub it on their teeth. I do this every night and it seems to work. The vet has commented how much better their teeth are doing. The dogs love it. They come running when they see the toothpaste tube and they fight over who gets their "toothies" done first.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: she liked it.
customer_reviews.text: I never brushed my dog's teeth before, dont know how she will react. I gave some for her to taste, just if she liked it.. now i brush her teeth 1-2x a day! She really loves the taste which makes it easier for me to brush.. I wanted to make brushing a fun and regular thing for her and avoid the pricey vet cost. I also used my finger to remove the plaque, so fast so good.. only been a few days but cant wait to see the difference! happy with my purchase! sorry I forgot to take a before pic! I should have.....
customer_reviews.author: CelenaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mold mold mold
customer_reviews.text: Had the mold issue too. Toothpaste should not come out brown. Used to use no problem. No more buying this product From Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in SD

customer_reviews.title: Brown Color Not Sage
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this before and it worked great. This time it came and had brown streaks in it and I know it is supposed to be white. I saw other comments had the same thing happen. It makes me nervous to give to my dog and I will throw this tube out. It just came today and I just opened it today and this is what it looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work even on really old tartar
customer_reviews.text: Got an old lab (10) who's had his teeth cleaned by a vet and after 6 months, they were bad again and he had bad breath. Tried this on a recommendation from a friend and it really seems to help keep his teeth cleaner and somewhat relieve the bad breath. I'm going to continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: This works wonderfully for my pups dental hygiene
customer_reviews.text: This works wonderfully for my pups dental hygiene. She a rescue dog and I had to have a few bad teeth removed a year ago. Since then, I do a quick little brushing each night and her oral health has improved immensely: her vet was very happy with the condition of her teeth and gums during our last visit. Besides keeping teeth and gums healthier, my dog also loves the flavor, which makes brushing a little easier, and it makes her breath smell good!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Side Up

customer_reviews.title: Important to brush dogs teeth!
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes all the flavors and enjoys the taste of the paste when I'm brushing. He doesn't especially enjoy the brushing part but he doesn't run away either. He is getting older and I don't want to have him anesthetized to get his teeth cleaned. This works very well if you brush regularly.
customer_reviews.author: minnymo

customer_reviews.title: This review is for product ONLY
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product before for all my dogs, and I have to say that they enjoy it and I believe it has helped them all with the teeth. So I would recommend this product (from a reputable seller). I bought this 2-pack for the value of it. Unfortunately, I did not realize this product was being sold by a questionable 3rd party. It arrived several weeks late. The boxes for each tube were damaged, as if opened. And when I inspected both tubes , they were opened and the color of each toothpaste were very off and suspicious. So for the safety of my dogs health I did not use them; I threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: The B0YS

customer_reviews.title: Bambi Approves
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old Pom loves the flavor, and makes brushing her choppers a breeze. She likes the flavor which is amazing because gel is clear but apparently beef flavored. I believe this is much cheaper on Amazon. A great buy that helps clean my pups growing teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Saywhat4you

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: My picky old boy LOVES this toothpaste! I have mixed feelings about the metal tube. I love that it’s better for the environment, but it makes canine teeth brushing even more challenging. Lol Just bought another 2 tubes! I cannot speak to the effectiveness of the toothpaste though. Despite daily tooth brushing, my old dogs still developed a thick plaque in a matter of months of a teeth cleaning. I think ultimately the toothpaste is just more of a treat to the dog than something helpful to the teeth
customer_reviews.author: ZebraYogi

customer_reviews.title: Product different b/c DIFFERENT SUPPLIER
customer_reviews.text: Supposedly the “new” color is the “new” normal. The manufacturer is using a different supplier. They claim it’s the same formula and is safe. So far my dog hasn’t had any negative reactions. I’ve also used beef & chicken in the past. I never had a problem. I’m still weary of this new change... but I’ll give the new vanilla mint a chance.
customer_reviews.author: tk

customer_reviews.title: BROWN and USED
customer_reviews.text: This toothpaste is supposed to be white, but this is the color mine came. The box and tube also looks like it was previously handled and potentially used by someone else. I am not going to risk giving this to my doggy. Lastly, getting a refund for this is a bit of a hassle. Buyer, beware!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: My dog hated this
customer_reviews.text: We tried only once this, but the second time my dog start running and vomiting after I put one pea in his teeth.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be a cheap skate
customer_reviews.text: It’s expensive because it works. I thought I would switch to a cheaper brand to see if I could save some $. Big mistake. In just few weeks I could see the tartar was building up and other brands just aren’t as effective. I brush my dogs teeth daily after she eats. So it’s not my technique.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hodge

customer_reviews.title: My 3 dogs love this toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I don't have to chase my dogs around the house to brush their teeth in fact, they come running to me to see who is first. This is the best canine toothpaste there is. My older 2 dogs (Westies) went 11 years without having their teeth professionally cleaned. The vet couldn't believe they never had their teeth cleaned. So he asked what I use or my secret I told him brushing their teeth at least 5 days a week with CET poultry toothpaste did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: More people should brush kitties' teeth
customer_reviews.text: Kitties hate getting their teeth brushed, but this does help keep their teeth clean. I recommend Poultry flavor over Malt - not because of how it tastes (I honestly have no idea) - but because the poultry flavor has a different, less sticky, texture compared to the very gummy Malt toothpaste. This makes the Poultry toothpaste easier to apply to your little toothbrush and makes it less likely that you will get sticky paste strands on yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Cat

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I can love a dog toothpaste as much as I do
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think I can love a dog toothpaste as much as I do. We had originally purchased another brand, but the poultry flavor really got to my stomach. Our dog seems to enjoy it, but he also eats poop every chance he gets so I don't think his standards are very high. After days of using the poultry-flavored toothpaste and holding our nose, I decided to just buy a different toothpaste. The vanilla flavor is really nice. Pleasing to the nose AND taste. He enjoys it as much as he did the previous toothpaste, and because the smell is so tolerable, we can get through daily brushing without gagging. His teeth also look beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I brush my cats teeth everyday thanks to this toothpaste! She actually likes the flavour and lets me brush her teeth (maybe for only 30 seconds or so but still better than nothing). I have used this before for previous dogs and they always go crazy for the poultry flavour. I tried the beef flavour with my cat and she didn't like it at all, but maybe that's just her. Definitely recommend as it makes brushing your cat/dogs teeth a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothpaste! I recommend this to any dog owners! I don’t understand how pet owners can brush a dogs teeth with peanut butter or poultry flavor... yuck... like you are kissing your dog and I don’t think you want to smell that. Toothpaste is suppose to make your mouth smell clean while keeping your teeth clean. My puppy loves this tooth paste while I love the sweet minty scent! This toothpaste is a crazy rave in the dog youtuber world! Very popular! Little pricey but you only use a little at a time and I haven’t seen any other mint tooth paste that has the qualities that this toothpaste has!
customer_reviews.author: Amber H.

customer_reviews.title: The best there is!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best! I have dachshunds, notorious for having dental issues, so I brush their teeth every single day if I can. They love the poultry flavor! I was a fan of the vanilla mint because it made their breath smell so good...but I gotta go with poultry since they love it so much. My vet highly recommends this toothpaste, and says my dogs’ teeth look much better since using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G

customer_reviews.title: Smells great and dog seems to love it
customer_reviews.text: I had previously used the salmon flavor toothpaste with my Boston Terrier due to trying to avoid chicken flavor because of potential allergies. There was nothing refreshing about my dog continuing to have fish breath so I decided to try the mint flavor and am very happy with the scent! It’s smells great and my dog was still eager to taste it. The consistently was a little sticky at first and got all over my dogs lip, so I put a little less on the toothbrush now to try to keep it all on the teeth.
customer_reviews.author: janel

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant fragrance--at least for humans.
customer_reviews.text: Although you can purchase a larger quantity of pet tooth paste for a lower price, this product has a great and long lasting fragrance for my dogs' teeth. I brush them daily. My dogs are no more fond of this flavor than MANY others I have used, but I like their breath better.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Chris

customer_reviews.title: With regular use, keeps your pets teeth healthy and saves you a lot of money in dental cleanings.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years, for daily brushing of teeth for my Schnauzers. You have to start young, to get them used to it and it just become part of life for them. My one Schnauzer made it to 18 years of age, with almost perfect teeth. Her dental cleaning helped kept her in good shape according to three Vets. The Vets highly recommend this product. After using it for over 20 years, I can tell you, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Vomiting for hours
customer_reviews.text: I recently got my dog the vanilla mint flavor since we have been using this brand for about a year and loving it. We usually use the beef flavor, and my dog loves to get her teeth brushed each morning. I switched to the vanilla mint when we ran out to see if the scent would help freshen her breath. Unfortunately, she absolutely hated the scent and flavor of this toothpaste. It was next to impossible to brush her teeth. About 20 minutes after brushing, she was vomiting for about 6 hours. She's become resistant to having her teeth brushed. I definitely do not recommend the vanilla mint flavor. The beef one is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Dog was allergic
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is great if your dog isn't allergic but mine developed severe sores on her nose. It took me a while to realize what was causing them. I'm sure most dogs are fine but if your dog starts getting sores, this might be the cause.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cockrell

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: Took a few times to get one cat to like it. The other took to it right away, and cries to get some before bedtime, knowing its "toothbrush time". I started by introducing the paste on a pet toothbrush , where they will eagerly lick it off. Next , random times , I will secure the kitty, and slowly use the toothbrush on their teeth. It hope using the toothbrush on their teeth will get easier, they don't like it now , but only tolerate it for seconds. At least they love this toothpaste! I just have a concern that it has a sugar based ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: Topaz

customer_reviews.title: Brown First Quarter Portion
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail. First thing I checked was if the paste was white. I had to squeeze out about a quarter amount to get to white. I have no idea why it's brown or if its bad or not. Not risking it. Tube was not sealed under the cap. I'll try the paste on my dogs now that I reached the white section. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie-the WeatherGuesser

product_meta.title: Virbac CET Enzymatic Toothpaste| Eliminates Bad Breath by Removing Plaque and Tartar Buildup | Best Pet Dental Care Toothpaste
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Vanilla MintThe C.E.T. brand has led the way for at-home pet dental care products for more than 30 years. These toothpastes are designed to be readily accepted by pets with 5 yummy flavors for all pets with the potential to form plaque. Virbac's knowhow has helped incorporate non-foamy enzyme and abrasive elements creating toothpastes that are safe for pets, even if swallowed! That's a big reason why the C.E.T. Brand is #1 recommended by veterinary professionals for at home pet dental care.
feature_bullets: FOR DOGS AND CATS: Enzymatic toothpaste specifically formulated using an enzyme system for dogs and cats to reduce plaque, freshen breath, and ensure a clean mouth with Vanilla Mint flavor pets love
SAFE FOR DAILY USE: Includes no foaming agents so this toothpaste is safe for pets to swallow
VET RECOMMENDED: Virbac is the Top Recommended dental brand by Veterinary professionals and Made in the USA

USE WITH A TOOTHBRUSH: Use a soft bristled toothbrush such as the CET Dual Ended Toothbrush, Apply daily or as directed by your veterinarian, Your veterinarian may give you specific directions follow this professional advice closely
SATISFACTION GUARANTEED: Virbac is committed to your experience of great satisfaction with Virbac products
